text:
And about the murder, he will do many good things later to make up for it. Calm down. He might still become a great man. So, how are you? How do you feel? 

"You're a cruel person! How can you make jokes about this? Let me go..." 

"Where are you going?" 

"To him. Do you know where he is? Why is this door locked? We came in that way, and now it’s locked. When did you lock it?" 

"We can’t shout about this in the apartment. I’m not making fun; I’m just tired of talking like this. But how can you go to him in this state? Do you want to betray him? You’ll make him angry, and he might turn himself in. Let me tell you, he is already being watched. You will just give him away. Wait a bit: I saw him and talked to him just now. He can still be saved. Please, sit down; let’s think this through together. I asked you to come so we could discuss it alone. But please, sit down!" 

"How can you save him? Can he really be saved?" 

Dounia sat down. Svidrigaïlov sat down next to her. 

"It all depends on you, only you," he said with bright eyes, almost whispering because he was so emotional. 

Dounia moved away from him in fear. He was shaking too. 

"You... one word from you, and he is saved. I... I will save him. I have money and friends. I will send him away right now. I will get a passport, two passports, one for him and one for me. I have friends... capable people… If you want, I’ll take…"

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Dounia is urged to consider her influence over her brother's fate, as Svidrigaïlov believes she can help save him from his dire situation.
